SEARCH
Package org.domain.algorithms

Class AbstractAlgorithm

java.lang.Object
org.domain.algorithms.AbstractAlgorithm
Direct Known Subclasses:
BruteForceAlgorithm, HillClimbingAlgorithm
public abstract class AbstractAlgorithm extends Object
AbstractAlgorithm serves as the base class for implementing various product arrangement algorithms. It provides shared utility methods and an abstract method for defining the main ordering logic. Subclasses should implement the orderProductList method to define specific algorithms.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Max Estrade Pey {max.estrade@estudiantat.upc.edu}

  • Field Details

    • similarityMatrix

      protected Map<String,Map<String,Double>> similarityMatrix
      A matrix that stores similarity scores between products. The outer map's key is the product name, and the inner map's key is the name of another product. The value is the similarity score between the two products.

  • Constructor Details

    • AbstractAlgorithm

      public AbstractAlgorithm(Map<String,Map<String,Double>> similarityMatrix)
      Constructs an `AbstractAlgorithm` with the specified similarity matrix.
      Parameters:
      similarityMatrix - A matrix that stores similarity scores between products. The outer map's key is the product name, and the inner map's key is the name of another product. The value is the similarity score between the two products.

  • Method Details

    • orderProductList

      public abstract ArrayList<ArrayList<Product>> orderProductList(ProductList list, int xsize, int ysize, int limit, HashMap<String,Pair<Integer,Integer>> coordinates)
      Arranges a given product list into an optimized distribution. Subclasses must override this method to provide specific implementations.
      Parameters:
      list - The product list to be arranged.
      xsize - Represents the number of columns of the distribution
      ysize - Represents the number of rows of the distribution
      limit - Serves to limit the depth we want to search for the solution. If limit is less than 0, the code ignores the limit
      coordinates - Contains the coordinates of the products in the distribution.
      Returns:
      A matrix that represent the arranged distribution of the list.
      Throws:
      DistributionException - If the ProductList is empty.

    • getName

      public abstract String getName()
      Retrieves the name of the algorithm.

      This method returns the name associated with this algorithm, which is typically used to identify or display the algorithm's name in various contexts.

      Returns:
      The name of the algorithm (e.g., "Brute Force").

    • adaptToShelf

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Product>> adaptToShelf(List<Product> list, int xsize, int ysize, HashMap<String,Pair<Integer,Integer>> coordinates)
      Adapts a linear list of products into a shelf-like 2D arrangement. The method divides the products into three shelves. Shelves alternate between left-to-right and right-to-left filling orders for aesthetic distribution. Remaining products beyond evenly distributed shelves are added to the last shelf.
      Parameters:
      list - The list of products to distribute.
      xsize - Represents the number of columns of the distribution
      ysize - Represents the number of rows of the distribution
      coordinates - Contains the coordinates of the products in the distribution
      Returns:
      A matrix that represent the arranged distribution of the list.

    • calculaSum

      public double calculaSum(List<Product> combination)
      Calculates the sum of similarities between consecutive products in a combination. This method iterates through the list and computes the total similarity between adjacent products. Similarity is defined by the getSimilarity method of the Product class.
      Parameters:
      combination - The list of products to evaluate.
      Returns:
      The total similarity score of the product combination.

    • mostSimilarP

      protected Product mostSimilarP(Product product, List<Product> candidates)
      Finds the most similar product to a given product from a list of candidates. This method iterates through the list of candidates and selects the product with the highest similarity score to the given product.
      Parameters:
      product - The product to compare.
      candidates - The list of products to compare against.
      Returns:
      The most similar product to the given product.
